required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reference Diameter and Characteristics of Distal Radial Artery by Ultrasonographic Assessement in Korean Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Reference Diameter and Characteristics of Distal Radial Artery by Ultrasonographic Assessement in Korean Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Radial access is recommended as the standard approach for coronary angiography (CAG) and percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) based on the evidence in which RA reduced mortality and bleeding events compared with femoral access. Recently, the use of distal radial artery (DRA) is rapidly increasing in accordance with the publication of several studies that have shown easy hemostasis, reduced bleeding complications and low arterial occlusion rate via distal radial approach. However, the diameter of DRA is relatively smaller than radial artery (RA) which can limit the widespread use of this access route. Regarding the size discrepancy, there is a lack of evidence to guide which patients are acceptable or not for CAG and PCI. Therefore, the main purpose of this study was to provide the reference diameter of DRA using ultrasonography in Korean patients. The clinical predictors for small DRA also were evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock:
Radial access is recommended as the standard approach for coronary angiography (CAG) and percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) based on the evidence in which RA reduced mortality and bleeding events compared with femoral access. Recently, the use of distal radial artery (DRA) is rapidly increasing in accordance with the publication of several studies that have shown easy hemostasis, reduced bleeding complications and low arterial occlusion rate via distal radial approach. However, the diameter of DRA is relatively smaller than radial artery (RA) which can limit the widespread use of this access route. Regarding the size discrepancy, there is a lack of evidence to guide which patients are acceptable or not for CAG and PCI. Therefore, the main purpose of this study was to provide the reference diameter of DRA using ultrasonography in Korean patients. The clinical predictors for small DRA also were evaluated.
Assessment of arterial diameter by ultasonography Patients were lying on the bed with relaxation in an quiet room. The outer diameters of both DRA and RA were assessed by a perpendicular angle using a linear ultrasound probe (3-4-10.8 MHz) and the average values were recorded. The diameter of RA was measured from 2-3 cm above wrist crease. Anatomical landmark for the measurement of DRA was the bony surface area just distal space from extensor pollicis longus tendon in which the DRA was best palpable then runs down between the first metacarpal and second metacarpal bone (just out of anatomical snuffbox area)

primary_outcome.measure: The diameter of distal radial artery
primary_outcome.description: Mean diameter of distal radial artery on both left and right hand

secondary_outcome.description: Mean diameter of radial artery on both left and right hand
Diameter of measure artery divided by body surface area

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of small distal radial artery
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of small distal radial artery (<2.3mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictor for small distal radial artery
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical predictor associated with small distal radial artery

arm_group.description: Male patients who performed transthoracic echocardiography with arterial ultrasonography
Female patients who performed transthoracic echocardiography with arterial ultrasonography

intervention.description: The diameters of both the radial artery and the distal radial artery were measured by ultrasonography.

study_pop.textblock: Patients planned to perform transthoracic echocardiography with arterial ultrasonography were consecutively enrolled in a single center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients planned to perform transthoracic echocardiography with arterial ultrasonography
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 20-year
- Poor image quality
- repeated measurement

overall_official.affiliation: Yonsei University Wonju College of Medicine, Wonju Severance Christian Hospital
